Toggle Menu

salt.modules.rabbitmq

Module to provide RabbitMQ compatibility to Salt. Todo: A lot, need to add cluster support, logging, and minion configuration data.

add_user

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.add_user(
								name,
								password=None,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Add a rabbitMQ user via rabbitmqctl user_add <user> <password>

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.add_user rabbit_user password

add_vhost

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.add_vhost(
								vhost,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Adds a vhost via rabbitmqctl add_vhost.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq add_vhost '<vhost_name>'

change_password

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.change_password(
								name,
								password,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Changes a user's password.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.change_password rabbit_user password

clear_password

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.clear_password(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Removes a user's password.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.clear_password rabbit_user

cluster_status

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.cluster_status(
								runas=None
								)

Details

return rabbitmq cluster_status

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.cluster_status

delete_policy

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.delete_policy(
								vhost,
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Delete a policy based on rabbitmqctl clear_policy.

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.delete_policy / HA'

delete_user

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.delete_user(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Deletes a user via rabbitmqctl delete_user.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.delete_user rabbit_user

delete_vhost

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.delete_vhost(
								vhost,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Deletes a vhost rabbitmqctl delete_vhost.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.delete_vhost '<vhost_name>'

disable_plugin

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.disable_plugin(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Disable a RabbitMQ plugin via the rabbitmq-plugins command.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.disable_plugin foo

enable_plugin

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.enable_plugin(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Enable a RabbitMQ plugin via the rabbitmq-plugins command.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.enable_plugin foo

force_reset

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.force_reset(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Forcefully Return a RabbitMQ node to its virgin state

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.force_reset

join_cluster

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.join_cluster(
								host,
								user='rabbit',
								ram_node=None,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Join a rabbit cluster

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.join_cluster 'rabbit.example.com' 'rabbit'

list_permissions

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_permissions(
								vhost,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Lists permissions for vhost via rabbitmqctl list_permissions

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_permissions '/myvhost'

list_policies

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_policies(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return a dictionary of policies nested by vhost and name based on the data returned from rabbitmqctl list_policies.

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_policies'

list_queues

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_queues(
								runas=None,
								*kwargs
								)

Details

Returns queue details of the / virtual host

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_queues messages consumers

list_queues_vhost

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_queues_vhost(
								vhost,
								runas=None,
								*kwargs
								)

Details

Returns queue details of specified virtual host. This command will consider first parameter as the vhost name and rest will be treated as queueinfoitem. For getting details on vhost /, use list_queues instead).

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_queues messages consumers

list_user_permissions

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_user_permissions(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

List permissions for a user via rabbitmqctl list_user_permissions

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_user_permissions 'user'.

list_users

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_users(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return a list of users based off of rabbitmqctl user_list.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_users

list_vhosts

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.list_vhosts(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return a list of vhost based on rabbitmqctl list_vhosts.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.list_vhosts

plugin_is_enabled

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.plugin_is_enabled(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return whether the plugin is enabled.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.plugin_is_enabled foo

policy_exists

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.policy_exists(
								vhost,
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return whether the policy exists based on rabbitmqctl list_policies.

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.policy_exists / HA

reset

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.reset(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return a RabbitMQ node to its virgin state

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.reset

set_permissions

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.set_permissions(
								vhost,
								user,
								conf='.*',
								write='.*',
								read='.*',
								runas=None
								)

Details

Sets permissions for vhost via rabbitmqctl set_permissions

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.set_permissions 'myvhost' 'myuser'

set_policy

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.set_policy(
								vhost,
								name,
								pattern,
								definition,
								priority=None,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Set a policy based on rabbitmqctl set_policy.

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.set_policy / HA '.*' '{"ha-mode": "all"}'

set_user_tags

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.set_user_tags(
								name,
								tags,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Add user tags via rabbitmqctl set_user_tags

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.set_user_tags 'myadmin' 'administrator'

start_app

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.start_app(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Start the RabbitMQ application.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.start_app

status

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.status(
								runas=None
								)

Details

return rabbitmq status

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.status

stop_app

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.stop_app(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Stops the RabbitMQ application, leaving the Erlang node running.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.stop_app

user_exists

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.user_exists(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return whether the user exists based on rabbitmqctl list_users.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.user_exists rabbit_user

vhost_exists

Syntax

salt.modules.rabbitmq.vhost_exists(
								name,
								runas=None
								)

Details

Return whether the vhost exists based on rabbitmqctl list_vhosts.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rabbitmq.vhost_exists rabbit_host
